issue.title: <frame/>: Support multiple frames in a single parent? Intended scope of frames? Use link names as frames?

content.raw: Question 1: the `pose_dom` branch is currently only parsing `<frame/>` elements under the `<model/>` tag, but I expect it would be added to the other DOM classes as well. The [link_chain.sdf](#!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/468/pose-dom/diff#chg-test/sdf/link_chain.sdf) example file has multiple `<frame/>` elements, which are tested in the [LinkChain test](#!/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/468/pose-dom/diff#Ltest/integration/link_dom.ccT534) in `test/integration/link_dom.cc`. So, yes, multiple frame tags are supported.
content.html: Question 1: the pose_dom branch is currently only parsing <frame/> elements under the <model/> tag, but I expect it would be added to the other DOM classes as well. The link_chain.sdf example file has multiple <frame/> elements, which are tested in the LinkChain test in test/integration/link_dom.cc. So, yes, multiple frame tags are supported.
